result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D. Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution released to victim.   jk/cp   CK# 14CH073342
Bond applied; partial refund.  jk/cp

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kmiec.  Victim rights compliance.  Restitution paid upfront.  Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1 - fined $2,000 plus costs incl. DNA surcharge.  Bond to apply.  DNA ordered; instructed to go to the sheriff's dept to give sample.  Count 2 - sentenced to 19 days KCJ.  Credit for 19 days served.  Costs ordered.  Bond to apply.  Any balance of bond shall be returned to poster.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.
Sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Amended
Restitution determined in the amount of $40.00 jointly & severally.  kmk
for Restitution Order ($40.00 joint & several)  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kmiec.  Case is resolved.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/5/14 @ 2pm.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $40 jointly/severally w/co-defts
for Subst. of Counsel - Atty Kmiec in place of Atty Berman
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kmiec.  Subst. of counsel approved by the court.  FPT 9/2/14 @ 1:15pm, JT 9/8/14 @ 9am.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Berman.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:29am-  DE does not qualify for veteran's court.  Attorney Berman is requesting an adjournment to look into whether the DE may be eligible for the behavioral health court.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Berman.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:18pm-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  Victim rights compliance.  DE waives right to speedy trial.  Attorney Berman is attempting to determine whether the DE is eligible for veteran's court & requests this case be severed from the co-defendant cases.  State does not object.  Court orders this case be severed.  Final pre-trial adjourned to June 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
filed by ADA Rosa Delgado
Regarding Pretrial Evidentiary Issues - filed by ADA Rosa Delgado

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Delgado

State's Notice Regarding Deft's Statements.
Submitted by ADA Delgado

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Berman.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:28am-  Matter heard with co-defendant cases.  Victim rights compliance.  DE demanded speedy trial on 1/31/2014.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 3/14/2014.  DE withdraws bond motion as bond has been posted.  Attorney Berman is requesting the DE be evaluated for veteran's court.  Discussion held.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
$5000 deposited on 2/11/14
for Modification of Bond - filed by Attorney David Berman
filed by Attorney David Berman    (2/26/2014 at 11am)
Final pre-trial on February 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 2/26/2014 at 11am.  NTBS by the Court.
(oral) by Atty. David Berman

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. David Berman. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Delgado.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Speedy trial demand. Judicial pretrial with co-defendants to be scheduled by Br. 7 clerk. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
David Berman

214 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on  1/31/14 @ 9 a.m.   $5000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
